speaker: Chapel Ruin
lines: Roof gone, stars for saints; the chapel keeps its shape anyway.
Pews rot into the floor like old teeth settling in new gums.
A cracked font cradles rainwater and moths who think it is a moon.
Someone has arranged bones into a cross that looks uncomfortable.
A candle stub waits with the patience of wax.
You strike flint. The flame remembers its part and enters on cue.
The air tightens, then lets go, like a sob swallowed on time.
From the doorway, a shadow decides you have said enough.

choices.text: Hold the candle high and finish the prayer.
Snuff it and meet the shadow outside.
Leave a coin on the font and back away.
